repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.abstract: Papers documenting Meyer's work as Chairman of the NRA, Millinery Code Authority and later Chairman of the Millinery Stabilization Commission, as well as other aspects of his career (as banker, arbitrator, and community leader).

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: 1910 Member, employees group which negotiated "Protocol of Peace".
1918 Founded, Urban League of White Plains, New York.
1920's Secretary, Industrial Council of the Cloak, Suit and Skirt Manufacturers Protective Association.
1929 Retired as partner of A. Beller and Co.
1931 Gov. Franklin D. Roosevelt named Meyer to Commission to study medical treatment for workers under workers' compensation.
1934 Head, Hotel and Restaurant Minimum Wage Board, NYSDOL.
1940 Chairman, Needlecraft Educational Commission (Advisory Board for Central High School Needle Trades).
1951 Chairman, Board of Trustees, Fashion Institute of Technology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The major portion of this collection covers the period 1934-1938 at which time Meyer was Chairman of the NRA, Millinery Code Authority and later Chairman of the Millinery Stabilization Commission. However, items covering other aspects of his career (as banker, arbitrator, and community leader) can be found throughout the collection.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Max Meyer Papers #5221. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: 5192: Paul Abelson Papers 5437 OH: Paul Abelson Interview Conducted by Jesse Carpenter 5807: Paul Abelson Additional Records 6165 mf: Paul Abelson Files on Microfilm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Louis Brandeis (1940); personal correspondence with Morris Crawford, editor, Women's Wear Daily; substantial correspondence with Alpheus Mason, Princeton University, and others concerning information on the life of Justice Louis Brandeis for Mason's book; Mason particularly requests recollections from Meyer regarding 1910 Protocol Agreement and other miscellaneous.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes additional correspondence re search for information on Brandeis for Alpheus Mason; with Louis Stark (New York Times) suggesting a national labor commission to handle complaints of union members (1945); medical care; re denunciation of editorial on Franklin D. Roosevelt; and other miscellaneous.
